attributes.action: investigate whether people who work for shops selling products in Britain are being exploited
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many shops are cheap for one reason - exploitation.

If it takes a worker 30 minutes to make 1 pair of jeans from scratch, and that pair of jeans is then sold for £6; after material costs, shipping, tax, sales-persons' wages, how much of that £6 goes to the worker who made it?

This is what we, the undersigned, want the British government to investigate whether any sort of exploitation is being carried out by any brands that sell in the UK market.

Although the workers are based in other countries, the products produced are sold in this country, and that is why we must make this our problem.
